title: Async Array Map
description: Map an array with async transformations
instructions:
Write an async function `asyncMap(array, asyncFunction)` that takes an array and an async function, and returns a new array with the async function applied to each element IN PARALLEL.

The asyncFunction takes a value and returns a promise that resolves to the transformed value.

Example: asyncMap([1, 2, 3], async (x) => x * 2) should return [2, 4, 6]

hints.content: Use array.map() to create an array of promises by calling asyncFunction on each element. Then use Promise.all() to wait for all of them.
Map over the array to create promises: `array.map(item => asyncFunction(item))`. This creates an array of promises. Pass it to Promise.all().
Use: `const promises = array.map(item => asyncFunction(item));` then `return Promise.all(promises);`
